phrases.phrase: Access to your Facebook account was denied. Please ensure that you have given our Facebook application the necessary privileges.
This action is available via POST only. Please press the back button and try again.
This action could not be completed because you are no longer logged in.
Activity stream for all registered members at {board_title}.
Activity stream for all users you follow.
Add New BB Code Media Site
Add-on IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
The add-on XML does not specify a valid add-on ID and cannot be installed.
Adjust color hues for the entire palette.
Adjust color hues for this group.
Admin navigation IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
Admin permission IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
Edit styles, style properties, and templates
{username} started a conversation with you called {conversation}.
{username} invited you to join the conversation {conversation}.
This allows you to delay each page load by the specified length of time. This will make the rebuild take longer, but can reduce load on an active server.
Allow anyone in the conversation to invite others
Allow cron entry to run automatically when scheduled
Allow new messages to be posted in this forum
Allow other people to see what page you are currently viewing
All permissions within this group will be deleted as well.
All posts from the other threads will be merged into this thread.
All required CSS templates must end in ".css".
All template *unit tags must specify a label.
These are all threads from {board_title} containing messages you have not viewed.
These are all threads from {board_title} that have been recently updated. You may also see what members have been doing recently.
All selected threads are already in the destination forum. Please select another forum.
These are all unread threads from {board_title}. You may also see what members have been doing recently.
Also comments on a profile post
Alternatively, you may use IP-based discouragement.
and receive email notifications of replies
You may archive the import log to a new database table by specifying a unique name here. For full details see this help article: Import Redirection.
Archive the import log to this new table
Are you sure you want to complete this import? If you do this, you will not be able to resume the import from the current point.
Attaches a file to a watched thread
The attachments directory could not be found.
Attachments or avatars are being stored in the file system. Please confirm the path to these.
This attachment cannot be shown at this time. Please try back later.
The attachment could not be read by the server. Please try again later.
Attach child nodes to another parent
Automatically watch threads that you create or when you reply
The avatars directory could not be found.
Awaiting moderation before being displayed publicly.
The ban will be automatically lifted on {date}.
Changes the alignment of the wrapped text.
Inserts an attachment at the specified point. If the attachment is an image, a thumbnail or full size version will be inserted. This will generally be inserted by clicking the appropriate button.
Makes the wrapped text bold, italic, underlined, or struck-through.
This is [B]bold[/B] text. This is [I]italic[/I] text. This is [U]underlined[/U] text. This is [S]struck-through[/S] text.
Displays text in one of several programming languages, highlighting the syntax where possible.
Changes the color, font, or size of the wrapped text.
This is [COLOR=red]red[/COLOR] and [COLOR=#0000cc]blue[/COLOR] text. This is [FONT=Courier New]Courier New[/FONT] text. This is [SIZE=1]small[/SIZE] and [SIZE=7]big[/SIZE] text.
[COLOR=color], [FONT=name], [SIZE=size] - Text Color, Font, and Size
Display an image, using the wrapped text as the URL.
Indents the wrapped text. This can be nested for larger indentings.
Displays a bulleted or numbered list.
Embeds media from approved sites into your message. It is recommended that you use the media button in the editor tool bar.
Disables BB code translation on the wrapped text.
Displays text that has been quoted from another source. You may also attribute the name of the source.
Links the wrapped text to the specified web page or email address.
Creates a link using the wrapped text as the target.
The board is currently being upgraded. Please check back later.
The board is currently waiting to be upgraded. Please complete the upgrade.
Breadcrumb tag must be within a navigation tag.
The callback class '{class}' for option '{option}' is not valid.
Cannot have content-checking if tag without a contentcheck part.
You cannot merge a thread redirection notice with another thread. Please deselect the redirection notice and try again.
You may add as many correct answers as you like. Empty answer fields will be ignored. Answers are not case-sensitive.
Change conflicting user name and email address
Circular reference found in template includes.
Class extending XenForo_Model, containing validation functions etc. for this service.
Click this image to show the full-size version.
Click the image to change your avatar.
Code event IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
Combo box tags must specify a name.
Commas are not allowed in user names.
Comments on your profile or status
Comments on your profile posts for other members
The confirmation email has been resent.
Confirm Deletion of BB Code Media Site
Confirm Deletion of Code Event Listener
Confirm Deletion of Permission Interface Group
Confirm Deletion of Server Error Log Entry
Confirm Deletion of Style Property Definition
Confirm Deletion of Style Property Group

  • Name: {name} (ID: {user_id})
  • Email: {email}

{message}

The contents of the uploaded image do not match the file's extension.

Conversations allow you to exchange messages with other members directly.

{receiver_username},

{username} started a personal conversation with you called "{title}".

To view this conversation, click here:
{view_link}

------------
To see all your active personal conversations, click here:
{inbox_link}
This conversation is closed and will not accept further replies or edits.

{receiver_username},

{username} added you to the existing personal conversation "{title}".

To view the conversation from the beginning, click here:
{view_link}

------------
To see all your active personal conversations, click here:
{inbox_link}

{receiver_username},

{username} replied to your personal conversation "{title}".

To view the latest replies, click here:
{view_link}

------------
To see all your active personal conversations, click here:
{inbox_link}
Cookies are required to log in to this site. You will not be able to login until they are accepted.
Cron entry IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
A CSS style property must have at least one CSS component.
Data attributes names may not look like integers.
Describes the purpose and use of this style property.
You did not complete the CAPTCHA verification properly. Please try again.
Disables the selected user upgrades while this upgrade is active. This is helpful if you have tiers of the same upgrade and don't want people to buy multiple levels.
You may disable this option to temporarily prevent entries from this feed being imported.
Disassociating with Facebook will cause a password to be generated for your account and emailed to {email}.
Discouraged users are subjected to annoying random delays and failures in system behavior, designed to 'encourage' them to go away and troll some other site.
Display this group in debug mode only
Display this navigation in debug mode only
You do not have permission to view this page or perform this action.
Do you already have an account?
Drag this image to crop it, then click Okay to confirm, or upload a new avatar below.
Else if tags may not have children.
Else if tag found after else tag.
Else or else if tag not found that was not a direct child of an if tag.
Else tags may not have children.
Email addresses must be unique. The specified email address is already in use.
The email address you entered has been banned by the administrator. Please try another.
Email notifications for new conversations, replies to existing conversations, and being added to an existing conversation.
An embedded YouTube player would appear here.
Empty the import log without archiving
Ensure that permissions are correct for any imported user groups and nodes.
Enter the email address of the Gravatar you want to use.
Enter {$id} where you want the user-entered media ID to be used.
You may enter multiple text values to replace by putting them on separate lines.
Enter the term used by this service to describe the account name, such as AIM Screen Name, ICQ UIN, etc.
Enter your password in the first box and confirm it in the second.
Enter your search and hit enter
Either the specified path to your IP.Board installation does not exist, or it does not contain the 'uploads' folder that contains avatars and file attachments.
An error occurred or the request was stopped.
An error occurred while connecting with Facebook. Please try again later.
Table names must contain only a-z, 0-9 and underscore characters.
It is not possible to create the table '{table}' due to the following error: {error}
The existing data required by the data writer could not be found.
Please provide a valid Facebook user ID. Facebook user IDs take the form of integers (whole numbers).
You may leave these fields blank to include the content provided by the feed, or enter your own text, inserting any of the following tokens to represent data from the feed:
Fetch and store remote URL avatars

IP.Board allows users to link to off-site images as avatars. Would you like any off-site images to be fetched and stored on your server? If you do not select this option, remote URL avatars will be ignored.
The following members could not be found: {members}.
The following placeholders will be replaced in the message: {name}, {email}, {id}.
The following templates contained errors and were not saved: {errors}
The following users conflicted with existing users' names or email addresses. Please resolve these conflicts.
The following users could not be imported due to errors.
The following users are logged as having used IP addresses used by {name} recently.
The following words were not included in your search because they are too short, too long, or too common: {words}
Form tags must specify an action.
The forum is currently closed. Only administrators may access the forum.
Found unexpected content within an admin control tag.
Found unexpected tag '{tag}' as a disabled control.
Free-form text, allows loose grouping of adjacent scalar properties.
Go to first message in thread
This is helpful if you wish to translate this language using the XML file directly.
Hide this navigation when there are no viewable children
Identity service IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
If any users have active upgrades, it is recommended that you disable this upgrade instead of deleting it.
If disabled, users will not be able to post new messages or edit or delete their own messages. Moderators will still be able to manage the contents of this forum.
If enabled, a moderator will have to manually approve any messages posted in this forum.
If entered, the URL to this forum will not contain an ID. Use a-z, 0-9, _, and - characters only. Note that once specified, changing this value will cause URLs to be broken.
If you have forgotten your password, you can use this form to reset your password. You will receive an email with instructions.
If selected, an administrator will need to manually approve users before their registration is completed.
If selected, users will need to click on a link in an email before their registration is completed.
If selected, users will only be able to view this node if they are explicitly granted permissions.
If you are setting a character set in vBulletin via config.php, you should enter that value here.
If specified, all visitors will view this item and its contents using the selected style, regardless of their personal style preference.
If specified, this will replace the title that displays under your name in your posts.
If unselected, users will not see this node in the list. However, if the URL is known, it will still be accessible.
If a user is in multiple user groups, their user title and user name CSS will come from the group with the highest display styling priority.
If this user is a content-specific moderator as well, those moderation privileges will be removed as well.
If you change your email, you may need to reconfirm your account.
The image could not be processed by the server. Please try another or contact the site owner.

The forums from your IP.Board have all been imported and are viewable by all visitors. You may use this page to quickly define your imported forums as publicly-viewable, viewable by members only, or viewable by staff only.

  • Member-only forums will have viewing permissions revoked for the Guests group.
  • Staff-only forums will have viewing permissions revoked by default, with only the Moderating and Administrating groups allowed.

If this level of configuration is insufficient, you may skip this step and use the full permissions editor to set up your forum permissions instead.
An import is currently in progress. If you are returning to continue the import, click the button below to continue where you left off.
IP.Board allows users to upload 'Personal Photos', which are often permitted to be larger than avatars. If a user has a personal photo, would you like to import it instead of their avatar?
Inactive questions are not presented to visitors.
Included template variable assignments must include a var attribute.
Included template variable mappings must include from and to attributes.
The interface of this site can be displayed to you using any of the languages you may pick here.
Invalid data found in navigation tag.
Invalid if or else if tag: missing is or hascontent attribute.
Invalid template include specified. A literal template name must be specified.
Invalid template include variable assignment specified. Only scalar variable names may be assigned.
Invalid template include variable mapping specified. Only scalar variable names may be mapped.
Invert colors for the entire palette.
Invited members will be able to see the entire conversation from the beginning.
Invite more members to participate in this conversation
IP address information for post #{number} by {user}
IP address information for profile post by {user}
The item will remain viewable by moderators and may be restored at a later date.
It is not possible to delete the last language.
It is not possible to prevent users from selecting the default style.
It is not possible to remove the default language.
It is not possible to remove the default style.
It is not possible to remove the last style.
It is not possible to remove this option from all groups. If you wish to delete this option, use the delete page instead.
It is recommended that you use an image that is at least 200x200 pixels.
terms and rules.
The last administrator cannot be deleted.
Leave a redirect that expires after
Leaving a conversation will remove it from your conversation list.
{user1}, {user2}, {user3} and 1 other person like this.
{user1}, {user2}, {user3} and {others} others like this.
You, {user1}, {user2} and 1 other person like this.
You, {user1}, {user2} and {others} others like this.
Liking your own content is considered cheating.
List items must specify an id.
List items must specify a label.
The list of BB codes you can use to spice up the look of your messages. This page shows a list of all BB codes that are available.
Lock conversation (no responses will be allowed)
You must be logged-in to do that.
Log and count visits to this page
You must log in or sign up to post here.
You must log in or sign up to reply here.
Master language XML files cannot be imported here.
You may enter a partial IP, using * at the end to ban a range of IPs (example: 192.168.*).
Media site IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
Members who liked the first message
Members Who Liked This Profile Post
This member limits who may view their full profile.
The time limit to edit this message ({minutes} minutes) has expired.
Your message has been submitted and will be displayed pending approval by a moderator.

Moderate all messages posted in this forum
The moderation queue is currently empty.
There are more records matching your filter. Please be more specific.
Must be in the same permission group.
You must be a logged-in, registered member of this site to perform this action.
You must wait at least {count} seconds before performing this action.
The news feed is currently disabled. This may be a temporary performance-saving measure if the site is very busy at present.
The news feed is currently empty.
{username} attached a file to the thread {threadTitle}.
{username} modified a post in the thread {threadTitle}.
New registrations are currently not being accepted.
The text (or HTML) you insert here must be valid within a <p> tag.
Node names/URL portions must contain more than just numbers or a "-".
Node names/URL portions must be unique. The specified name is already in use.
Note that email clients handle HTML in widely varying ways. Be sure to test before sending HTML emails. A text version of your email will be generated by removing all HTML tags.
Note: you are not editing the master style.
Notify user if action was taken
You will not be notified of any future responses and the conversation will remain deleted.
It will not be possible to display this option until the problem is resolved by editing the option definition.
It is not possible to reply to messages that are not part of the same conversation.
No account upgrades can be purchased at this time. Please check back later.
No add-ons have been installed yet.
No BB code media sites have been added yet.
There are no comments to display.
No email addresses have been banned.
No feeds have been registered yet.
No Gravatar found for specified email address.
No identity services have been defined.
No IP address information is available for this content.
No one has liked this post yet.
You have insufficient privileges to post here.
You have insufficient privileges to reply here.
No posts matching the criteria specified were found.
No questions have been created yet.
No recent activity information is available for {name}.
No reports have been closed during this period.
No smilies have been added yet.
No trophies have been created yet.
You have no unread threads. You may view all recent threads instead.
No users matched the specified criteria.
No user upgrades have been created yet.
Number of times something posted by {name} has been 'liked'
The official name of this service, such as Yahoo! Instant Messenger.
Once your birthday has been entered, it cannot be changed. Please contact an administrator if it is incorrect.
Only array data types may be represented as array values.
Only generate a list of email addresses
Only literal CSS templates may be included by the require tag.
Only send to users opting to receive emails from the admin
Open this link in an overlay
Optionally describe the trophy and the criteria the user needs to meet to be awarded it.
Options tag must have a source attribute.
Automatically Adjust Case of Discussion Titles
You may choose to apply sentence or title case to discussion titles automatically, should you wish to do so.
User alerts will disappear from the alerts list this many days after being viewed. Unviewed alerts do not expire.
Controls how many alerts are shown on each page of users' full alert list.
Hours to Retain Viewed Alerts in Popup

The alert popup will show all unviewed alerts, plus any viewed alerts that were viewed within the time frame (in hours) before now. Note that the total amount shown in this popup is limited to no more than 25.
List the file extensions that are allowed to be uploaded. Use spaces or line break between extensions.
The maximum allowed dimensions for attached images (width x height). Use 0 or blank to not restrict dimensions.
Provide the maximum attachment file size in kilobytes (KB). Attachments over this size will be rejected.
Use 0 to allow an unlimited number of attachments per message. To disable message attachments, use the permissions system.
The maximum width and height of generated attachment thumbnails.
Enter a description for your board. This will be placed inside the meta description tag for the forum home page, so avoid using HTML.
When the board is inactive / closed, this message will be shown to site visitors. You may use HTML.
The title of your board. This will be displayed at the top of pages and used in emails.
The primary URL to your board. Do not include a trailing "/" or "index.php". The URL should look similar to this: http://www.example.com/forum
If an email cannot be delivered, the bounce notification will be returned to this email address. If left blank, bounced messages will be returned to the default email address.
CAPTCHAs help prevent spammers from registering or posting.

When enabled, clicking on a link to a category will take you to a dedicated page that only shows the children of that category. When disabled, users will be redirected to the full forum list and scrolled to the correct category.
This character will be repeated for each character in a censored word that does not otherwise have a replacement specified. For example, if "dog" is censored, it may be replaced with "***".

This is a list of words or phrases that are to be censored. If a replacement word or phrase is entered, the censored text will be rewritten to this (for example, replacing "dog" with "cat"). If no replacement is entered, the censored text will be replaced with censor characters (for example, "***").
Email address where board-related messages will be sent.
This is the URL to the page where users will be able to contact you.
Hours to Retain Read Conversations in Popup
The conversations popup will show all conversations with unread replies, plus any read conversations whose most recent replies fall within the time frame (in hours) before now.
This is the default email address that emails will be sent from.
When developing on a local server, the speed of responses can be too fast for debugging. Adding a value here will delay POST responses by the number of seconds you specify.
Enter the words or phrases that are disallowed in custom user titles. All censored words are automatically disallowed. Place each word or phrase on separate lines.
You may present discouraged users with a blank page from time to time. Enter the percentage chance of this happening.
Discouraged users will be subjected to a page loading delay of a random period between the two values provided here.
The standard minimum time between messages can be multiplied to make discouraged users wait longer between posting. Enter a multiplier here.
Enter the percentage chance that discouraged users will find the news feed disabled when they attempt to use it.
Enter the percentage chance that a discouraged user will be redirected to the redirection page.
You may randomly redirect discouraged users to a different page. Leave this blank to redirect to the forum home page.
When discouraged users attempt to search, this option defines the percentage chance that they will find it disabled. (0 = never, 100 = always)
The number of characters that will be used to create the discussion/thread preview when hovering over the title. Use 0 to disable the preview.
This controls the maximum number of discussions (such as threads) that will be shown on one page.
If specified, emails sent by XenForo will default to being from this name. If no value is entered, the board name will be used.
With this option disabled, viewing the news feed will be completely disabled.
With this option disabled, the search engine will not function.
Use the boxes here to enter the Facebook User IDs of any users you would like to be able to administer Liked pages.
This field is not required if you have provided an application ID.
The ID that is associated with your Facebook application for this domain.
The secret for the Facebook application you created for this domain.

If this feature is enabled, various places in XenForo, including the Member List will, show a selection of the current visitor's Facebook friends who have also signed up to your forum through Facebook. If the current visitor is not signed into Facebook, or has no registered friends, nothing will be shown.

This feature requires the application ID and application secret fields above to be completed.
Change the text shown on Facebook Like / Recommend buttons.

If this feature is enabled, a Facebook 'Like' or 'Recommend' button will be displayed on various pages including the thread view page, allowing Facebook users to 'Like' the page and in doing so, share it with their Facebook friends.

This feature does not require the Facebook application ID or application secret fields to be completed.
Users will have to wait this many seconds between posting messages. Users with the permission "Can Bypass Flood Check" will be exempt from this option.
The URL specified here will be used to give information (such as a map) about a physical location. The URL must include a {location} token.
You may enter your Google Analytics web property ID here to have the Analytics HTML automatically added to your public-facing pages.

If enabled, your users may source their avatars from Gravatar. When a new user registers, XenForo will automatically search for a Gravatar associated with their email address. If disabled, this will not remove Gravatars from users that already have them.
When events happen that affect individual users, they are alerted via this system. As large volumes of alerts are generated, they are periodically pruned from the database.
These options control how your site appears to your visitors.
Attachments are files that are uploaded to the board along with messages.

The add-on {addon}, to which this option group belongs, is currently disabled.

You may enable the {addon} add-on on the list of installed add-ons.
Turn your board on and off here.
User-generated text will be subject to the censorship rules you define here.
These options are intended to be directly manipulated solely by the XenForo developers.

The 'Discourager' is a system that aims to make the browsing experience of 'discouraged' users as frustrating as possible, with the goal of having them give up and leave.
You may set a user into 'discouraged' mode by editing their user profile, or discourage an IP address or IP address range.
Messages are contained within a discussion container, and options relating to these can be found here.
These options control the integration of Facebook features into XenForo.
Option group IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
Options here control messages posted by users to the system, including messages in threads, profile posts, personal conversations etc.

The news feed, or activity stream is a constantly-updated log of things that your registered members do, which can be viewed back by other visitors.
It is possible to filter the news feed down to just users you follow, or a single user.
The node and forum list is the primary navigational structure for XenForo's forums and pages.
Options here allow you to turn off or tweak systems in order to fine-tune the performance of your site.
These options control the behavior of the search system built-in to XenForo to allow searching of messages and other content.
You may tweak various link-building and content display options here.
For some functions, XenForo will hand off to a third party service provider. You may change some of the defaults used here.
Default options for the Spam Cleaner system are located here.
Controls to manage integration of XenForo with Twitter
In order to maximise your 'signal to noise' ratio when displaying threads to guests, you may hide your members' signatures.
All dates and times will be displayed to guests in this time zone.
This is the URL to your home page, outside of the board. If this is left blank, 'Home' will not appear in the navigation.
Option IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
With this disabled, a URL such as /threads/my-thread.128/ would exclude the title and be output as /threads/128/
Specify a URL to be used for requesting more information about an IP address. The URL must include {ip}, which will be replaced with the actual IP address.
If you are using a different domain or a CDN to host your XenForo JavaScript, enter the URL of your 'js' directory here.
Controls the source of the jQuery core JavaScript library. You may host this yourself (Local) or use one of the recommended CDN sources.
If a discussion spans multiple pages, the last few pages are displayed on the discussion list. Set the maximum number of pages to show here. Set the number to 0 to disable this feature.
LightBox displays all images on page

If this option is enabled, the LightBox overlay in which images are loaded will show all attached and hot-linked images from all messages on the current page. If disabled, the LightBox will show only images from the current message.
Link Logo to Home Page URL
If a home URL is provided, select this option to link the main page logo to that URL. If this option is not selected, the logo will always link to the forum index.
This number reflects the maximum number of search results that will be found, before permissions are taken into account. Setting this too high may cause performance problems.
Maximum Usernames in Members Online Now Box

In order to prevent the 'Members Online Now' becoming enormous on a very busy board, you may limit the number of names before a '... and 12 more' link is added to terminate the list. A value of 0 disables the limit.
Limit the number of members to show on each page of the registered member list, and online members list.
Use 0 to allow an unlimited amount of images per message.
The maximum number of characters that can be in a message. This includes BB code. Use 0 to disable the limit.
Use 0 to disable this limit. Disabling the limit or setting it too high is not recommended, as numerous media embeds can cause browser performance problems.

If true, CSS will be run through minify before being served.

Note: This process is currently very slow and defaults to 'off'. We will revisit this option for a later version of XenForo.
Once news feed items for a particular user are fetched and processed, cache them to help performance, rather than re-fetching and re-processing them every time they are viewed.
News Feed Items to Fetch With Each Request

The maximum number of news feed items to fetch when a user views their news feed. Also controls how many will be cached. Higher numbers require more resources both in terms of storage and processing time.
News Feed Message Snippet Maximum Length
When the text of messages is displayed in news feed items, it will be trimmed to the length specified here.

After a user interacts with the system (by clicking a link etc.) they will be considered 'online'. They will be considered to be offline if they do not interact with the system again within the time specified here.
This is the primary email address on your PayPal account. If this is incorrect, payments may not be processed successfully. Note this must be a PayPal Premier or Business account!
This will limit the number of choices that can be given as responses to a poll.
Prevent discouraged IP addresses from registering
You may prevent any visitors browsing from discouraged IP addresses from registering new accounts. They will be informed that registration is currently disabled.
If entered, a privacy policy link will be included in the footer.
Node Types to Include in Quick Navigation Menu

When building the quick navigation menu, include the node types specified here. If an allowed node type is a child of an excluded node type, it will not be shown. Note that this does not change the node list on this page.
This is the number of days to maintain read marking data (such as for threads and forums). Data older than this will always been seen as read.
In order to keep the registration form short, many preferences are not shown. This option allows you to set the default values for newly registered users.
When checking for other users having used the same IP addresses as those logged for a spammer, this control limits the search to the last x days.
These are the default options that will be checked when running the spam cleaner. The individual who actually runs the spam cleaner will have the opportunity to alter these options.

This is the default text for the email that can be sent to users when the spam cleaner is applied against them. This can be used in situations where you believe the spammer is human and may have made a mistake. {username}, {boardTitle}, and {contactUrl} will be replaced with their respective values automatically.

This controls what happens to messages made by spammers when the spam cleaner is applied against them. Note that if content does not support removal from view, it will be permanently deleted regardless of this setting.
This controls what happens to threads started by spammers when the spam cleaner is applied against them.
The spam cleaner will only be available to act against users who meet these criteria. If any of these criteria are set to 0 (zero) they will be ignored.
Using the Flash uploader allows those visitors with Adobe Flash installed to select multiple files to upload once, and to see a progress meter during the upload.
This link will be shown in the footer and users will have to agree to the terms and rules during registration.

Enabling the Tweet button will allow your visitors to share pages easily using their Twitter account.

You may also specify up to two Twitter accounts to recommend to visitors after they use the Tweet button. More info...
If you enable this option, the links generated by the system will not include "index.php?". However, to enable this, mod_rewrite must be available and an appropriate .htaccess file must be in place.
This controls the minimum and maximum length of usernames. Use 0 to disable a limit.
Otherwise, messages will be placed into the moderation queue.

You may optionally specify a PHP callback here in order to fetch more data or alter the controller response for your page.

Callback arguments:
  1. XenForo_ControllerPublic_Abstract $controller
    The controller instance. From this you can inspect the request, response etc.
  2. XenForo_ControllerResponse_Abstract &$response
    The standard response from the page controller.

The permission tester allows you to view the forum with the permissions of the specified user. You will still be logged in as yourself, but your permissions will show you what is visible for this user.
As this user's permissions will be applied to your account, keep in mind that user-specific permissions will affect you. For example, if the user you're testing as can only edit his/her own posts, you will only be able to edit your own posts.
Note that account changes such as bans will not be reflected by this system. You will not be able to post as this user or see their personal conversations.

Style properties in this style can not be modified. Please try another.
This styles the element that appears when AJAX operations are in progress.
Controls the appearance of the pointer-arrow attached to alert balloons.
Controls the appearance of the balloons that appear above Inbox and Alerts in the navigation bar to indicate unread items.
If you enable animations, you can adjust the speed using the multiplier. 1: Normal speed, 0.5: double speed, 2: half speed etc.
Controls the display of most avatars (user identity pictures) shown throughout the system.
Styles the row in which the type of BB code is noted (HTML, Code etc.)
Controls the basic layout of a BB code block such as [quote] or [code].
Styles the area containing code such as [php], [html] and [code].
Controls the appearance of the attribution row that sits above a quoted message.
This styling applies to the message area of [QUOTE] blocks, styling the actual quoted message itself.
This definition is used together with the BB Code Block definition to provide styling for [QUOTE] blocks.

This property controls the CSS for the main <body> element of XenForo pages.
Primarily, it is used for text styling, which is inherited by almost all other elements within XenForo.
Sometimes the top breadcrumb is associated with a call to action button. This property controls the container for that button.
Controls the container within which the breadcrumb sits.
You may optionally display the board title at the head of your breadcrumb.
This property controls the .button class, which is used for form controls and action buttons throughout the system.
Used to style the 'clicked' state of call to action buttons
Used to style the mouse-over / hover state of call to action buttons.
Controls the <span> inside call to action buttons
Controls the style of major call to action buttons such as 'Reply to Thread'.
Applied to level one (no parent) categories. The majority of the styles for category strips come by default from the @subHeading style property.

The styling of the main page area is controlled with this property.
Its primary function is to provide the content background color.
Styles longer explanatory text that may appear below form controls in control units.
Styles the area containing the actual form controls and any explanation text within the control unit.
Defines a horizontal spacing either side of control units.
Controls the display of any inline validation errors that appear with form element labels.
Styles any supplementary text to accompany the label for form controls in the labels area.
Defines the width of the label area to the left of form control units.
Controls the area containing the label within the control unit.
Controls the individual blocks around which forms in XenForo are built.
Style property definitions must be unique per style. The specified ID is already used in this style.
Controls the appearance of flags / icons for discussions such as sticky, locked etc.
Controls the width of the avatar cell.
Controls the appearance of the avatar of the user who started the discussion.
Controls the display of text on the first row of discussion list items, including the title.
Controls individual items within the discussion page nav.
Changes applied to page links on hover.
Item Page Nav Link, Hover State
Controls the width of the 'last message' cell.
Mini-Me is the small avatar of the current visitor that shows up on discussions in which the visitor has posted.
Mini-Me is the small avatar of the current visitor that shows up on discussions in which the visitor has posted.
Controls the appearance of the display options panel that can appear below the discussion list.
This option allows the multi-page navigator shown on discussion list items with multiple pages to remain hidden until the item is moused-over.
Hide item page navigator unless hovered
Controls the second row of text for discussion list items.
Controls the width of the statistics cell.
Alters the display of discussion list item titles when they contain unread messages.
Controls the width of external authentication buttons such as 'Login with Facebook'.
The content of the rich text editor should appear in the same colors, fonts etc. as your messages. If it does not, you can use this style property to tweak the appearance.
You may disable all overlays and instead load full pages by switching off this option.
Choose a color scheme for all Facebook plugins in this style.
Path to the RSS feed icon shown on forums.
Styles the container of the style and language chooser trigger controls.
Styling to be added to links in the main footer section in their hover state.
Styling for links in the main header section
Styles the block of links usually shown on the right of the footer.
Controls the appearance of the container for the upper footer section.
Defines the amount that controls should be indented from controls upon which they depend.
Form Control Unit Controls Indent Width
Styling for placeholder / prompt text in text controls.
Controls the appearance of buttons in form overlays.
Styles any supplementary text provided for control labels etc.
Controls minor headings within form-type overlays.
Controls hovered tabs on form overlays.
Control the panel that sits below a collection of tabs in a form overlay.
Controls the appearance of tabs within form overlays.
Controls the appearance of individual tabs within form overlays.
Controls disabled text controls in form overlays.
Controls text controls in form overlays when focused.
Controls the placeholder / prompt text within text controls in form overlays.
Alters the appearance of text controls within form-type overlays.
Controls textual headings within form-type overlays.
Controls the appearance of form-type overlays.
Controls the width of forms using the .xenForm class.
Path to the icon shown for unread forums.
Style property groups must be unique per style. The specified ID is already used in this or a parent style.
Controls the appearance of BB code elements within messages.
Controls the breadcrumb unit, which allows users to navigate back up to the site home page.
Contains properties used to style the various types of buttons used by XenForo.
The set of colours used to build this style.
Controls the appearance of the list of discussions within a forum or a conversation etc.
Controls the bottom of the page
Controls the appearance of form-type overlays and their contents.
Defines the layout and style of most forms in XenForo.
General style settings for this style.
Controls the appearance of the header and navigation elements of all pages.
Styles the blocks used for each member on the member list.
Style properties for pages showing detailed information about members.
Controls the layout of the full-size message template.
Controls the content area of the full message template.
Controls the appearance of the list of forums, categories, pages etc.
Styling for overlays and tooltips that allow content to be displayed on-top of regular page content.
Controls multi-page links, link groups and tabs other than those in the header.
Styling for most popup menu elements can be found here.
Controls building-block classes used for the vast majority of the XenForo interface.
Controls the XenForo sidebar and various elements that appear within it.
Enter the height in pixels that you would like to reserve for the logo in the header.
This path describes the location of the main logo image used in the header of all pages.
This property controls the browser background and text.
This path represents either the relative or absolute path to images used by the XenForo user interface. You may change this to point to a CDN if you wish.
The values specified here will be applied to items selected for inline moderation.
Controls the amount of separation between items in link groups.
Individual links within link groups, as defined above.
Styles normal textual links when hovered.
The default styling for textual hyperlinks.
The height in pixels of the collapsed login bar.
Controls the layout and appearance of the form element within the login bar.
Controls the appearance of the handle by which the login bar is activated.
Textual hyperlinks within the login bar.
Extra properties for text controls when disabled.
Extra properties for text controls when focused.
Controls the appearance of text boxes in the login bar.
Additional properties to be applied to the login bar username input box.
Controls the basic styling of the login bar.
Minimum width of the primary log in button.
This property applies to the user avatar shown in member list items.
Sometimes, info about a post or thread etc. will be shown inside a member list item. This applies styling to that content.
Width of fixed column in extended member list items.
On occasions, extra content is added to member list items. Use this to restyle it.
Applied in addition to the regular username styling.
Controls the style of the container for everything in the member list item except the user avatar.
This property is applied to the contain for all user info underneath the main username link.
Applies to the main username link on member list items.
User titles in member list items are styled with this property.
Controls the appearance of the container for member list items.
The smaller text that sometimes appears below the main menu title.
The large text that appears at the top of pop-up menus.
The minimum height for pop-up menus.
Defines the minimum width for all pop-up menus.
The main container for the pop-up part of pop-up menus.
Styles the block that surrounds the large avatar for a message author.
This is used to enclose the message text and any other user-generated content for the message, such as attached files.
Controls the appearance of the (optional) extra user info that can be displayed under the message poster's avatar and username.

This element contains the content area of the message template.
In the default style, it is used to enclose the right column of the message template, which contains the message text and controls.
This styles the block that displays the summary of users who have liked the message.
This is the container used for lists of messages.
Defines the appearance of message controls such as Edit, Delete, Like, Reply.
This block sits below the main content area and includes the inline moderation checkbox, permalink and message controls.
Notices are used to display information such as the message being in the moderation queue, or being deleted.
Container for controls generally seen only by privileged visitors - Edit, Delete, IP etc.
Container for controls seen by general visitors - Like, Reply etc.
Show the gender of the message poster, if specified.
Display a link to the home page of the message author, if they have entered one.
Show the message author's location, if they have provided one.
Display the total number of messages posted by the message author.
Show the message poster's occupation, if specified.
Display the date on which the message author signed up.
Display the total number of times content by the message author has been 'liked'.
Display the message poster's total accumulation of trophy points.

The text shown in the body of full-size messages will be controlled by the values set in this property.
It does not apply to small messages, such as profile posts and comments, which use the text styling from 'body'.
This unit directly encloses the avatar, username and other user info for a message.

This container encloses the avatar, username, user title and additional user info elements.
Its primary purpose in the default style is to provide the left column of the message template.
Styling for the name of the person who posted the message.
Styles the container for the author username and user title next to messages.
Controls the appearance of the user title displayed with the message poster's username.
This element entirely surrounds each message.
Controls each individual navigation tab link.
Styles links under the selected navigation tab, in their hover state.
Styles each link in the row of controls below the selected navigation tab.
Styles the currently-selected header navigation tab.
Controls the container for the header navigation tabs.
The triangle / arrow attached to node description tooltips
Controls the display of non-tooltip node description text.
Controls the large icon shown on forum, page and link nodes.
This controls the block of info describing the last post made within a forum (usually) node.
Include descriptions underneath node titles on the main node list.
Show Forum Descriptions on Node List
Show descriptions only when hovering over forum titles on the main node list.
Controls the display of the total number of discussions, messages etc.
This controls the area within which the main text for node display is contained.
Changes to be made to tiny icons when the mouse moves over them
This controls the appearance of small icons such as the RSS feed icon.
Extra properties to apply to node titles when they contain unread content.
Controls the display of non-category node titles
This logo will be displayed in Facebook when a visitor likes a page on your site. Must be at least 50x50 and should be square.
Styles the 'close' gadget that is added when no other control is provided to close an overlay.
Speed in milliseconds for overlays to fade out. Default: 100.
Defines the width of the label area to the left of form control units within overlays.
Form Control Unit Label Width in Overlays
Controls the width of forms using the .xenForm class when being shown in an overlay.
Controls the degree of transparency of the mask applied to the background content when an overlay is shown. Default: 0.6; fully transparent: 0; fully opaque: 1.
This is the property that controls the main container for overlays, including their border and shadow etc.
Speed in milliseconds for overlays to fade in. Default: 200.
Default position of overlays relative to the top of the browser window.
Styles the optional description text that may be presented below the page title.
These rules are applied in addition to the normal page link rules in order to distinguish the current page.

This element is used in instances where a page navigation block is placed alongside a group of links, such as above the list of threads on the forum view, or above the list of messages on thread view.
Controls the amount of space between individual page navigation links.
This width is the basis for all page navigation links.
Used to style each individual page navigation link including pages, next and previous buttons, and the scroll arrows.
Controls the appearance of page links when the mouse hovers over them.
Controls the appearance of the scroll buttons that appear when more than seven pages are available.
The container for the page navigation element, normally controls overall elements such as font size etc.
Points down, indicates the menu can be opened
Indicates that the menu can be closed
Controls the appearance of popup controls as the mouse passes over them when the menu is closed.
Styles the arrow attached to content preview tooltips that points to the content.
This defines the style of the element used for thread, and other content preview tooltips.
Styling for links within primaryContent containers.
Styles text that describes where the user was last active.
Styles the values for fields in sidebar info blocks.
Styles the labels for data in info blocks.
Controls the styling of the outer section of sidebar info blocks.
Specifies the width of the sidebar for the member profile page. This sidebar is usually the same width as the large avatar.
Controls the height of the tabs on the profile page.
Styles profile page tabs when hovered
Controls the amount of indent from the notional left margin to the tabs area.
Additional styling for the selected tab on the profile page.
Styles the tabs at the top of the profile page.
Styles the large heading showing the name of the person whose profile page this is.
Styles the text of the current user status message, if shown.
Styles the outer container for the profile page elements.
Styles the content of redirect messages shown after AJAX submissions.
Styles the container for redirect messages that appear after some forms are submitted with AJAX.
Styling for links within secondaryContent containers.
Footnotes or summary for a section
Controls the layout of the sidebar element.
This styling is applied to user status message tooltip arrows, in addition to the regular tooltip arrow styling.
This styling is applied to tooltips showing user status messages, in addition to the regular tooltip styling.
Occasionally, sub-headings may be used as block-level links. In these cases, this property controls what happens to the sub-heading link on hover.
Controls the appearance of the selected tab.
Controls general tabs in their hover state.
Controls the appearance of tabbed user interfaces other than those in the navigation bar.
Controls the appearance of individual tabs in general tabbed interfaces.
Additional styling to be applied to text controls if they are to contain code rather than regular text.
Additional styling to be applied to text controls in their disabled state.
Styling to be applied to text controls when they receive focus.
Additional styling to be applied to text controls when focused if they are multi-line textarea types.
Styling to be applied to <input type="text" /> and <textarea> text-editing elements.
Display text underneath the main page title.
Show forum descriptions on thread list
The extra arrow often shown with tooltips.
The basic styling for all generic XenForo tooltips.
Styling for links posted in messages.
Layout for the visitor panel. The image size is controlled by the @visitorPanelAvatarSize property.
